Re: What would you say you do here?

About

Nate Schier

<nathaniel.schier@email.com>
2:37 PM (0 minutes ago)

Hi friend,

I am a full stack engineer and consultant with a primary focus on JavaScript. If you would like to explore working with me, please send me a message.

While I have been putting things online ever since I built my high school's baseball team's website (please excuse the dead image links) back in 2005, my path to working as a developer is a bit more recent.

After graduating from Pomona College in sunny SoCal, living in Hawaii for a year, working at a high-end recruiting startup on the east coast, and co-founding and building Sidebench (a digital product consultancy) for five years (#329 on the Inc. 500 list for 2017), I decided to leave Sidebench and fully return to the wonderful world of code in July of 2017.

Since then I have been working as a contractor while continually studying, learning, and most importantly building things to grow my own full-stack development skillset. Thus far I have focused primarily on JavaScript, and more specifically React & Node, though I am interested in expanding out from there as well. I am also working my way through Harvard's CS50 course, and I plan to continue with other online CS courses to build a solid computational foundation and explore new fields.

Technologies that I am currently comfortable with include JavaScript, React, Vue, Node, Python, Express, MongoDB, RethinkDB, REST APIs, Mocha, Chai, webpack, Babel, Git, Yarn/npm, Heroku, and Firebase.

While not everything I have done thus far can be shared publicly, a few projects of mine are listed below. You are welcome to view my full GitHub profile as well.

  • Eat On The Way: React/Node tool that makes use of the Yelp Fusion and Google Maps Distance Matrix APIs
  • TL;DR Twitter Bot: fun little experiment I did to familiarize myself with the Twitter API
  • This Site: an exploration in Vue.js and honing my styling skills in an entertaining way

I am interested in contract, consulting, apprenticeship and potentially full-time opportunities. If you are interested in chatting, please shoot me a message.

Cheers,

Nate
